intro: Selago glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular selago, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its stems are often covered with glandular hairs, giving it its scientific name. Selago glandulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream sides.
